#howto install the perl client
 
 1. make sure your "ssl-dev" packages are installed, this could be:
  1. libssl-dev (debian)
 1. male sure "make" and "automake" are installed
 1. install the client library
{{{
$> sudo perl -MCPAN -e 'install REST::Client, Text::Table, JSON, Module::Pluggable, Config::Simple, Snort::Rule, Class::Accessor, Digest::MD5, Digest::SHA1, Regexp::Common::net, Regexp::Common::net::CIDR'
$> wget http://cpan.develooper.com/authors/id/S/SA/SAXJAZMAN/cif/CIF-Client-0.01_05.tar.gz
$> tar -zxvf CIF-Client-0.01_05.tar.gz
$> cd CIF-Client-0.01_05
$> perl Makefile.PL && make && sudo make install
}}}
 1. setup your [ClientSetup#Global_Configuration_File configuration file]
 1. run a sample query for testing:
{{{
$> cif -h
$> cif -q example.com
$> cif -q 192.168.1.0/24
$> cif -q c09bdd5529fa4111758a7e8de0d615a6
$> cif -q url/246c9fa16cdc19411ace5cb43c301d2c
$> cif -q malware -s low
$> cif -q infrastructure
$> cif -q infrastructure/network -p snort
$> cif -q domain -p bindzone
$> cif -q url -w low | grep -v private
}}}
